ygData.subject: Re: New server, new smith
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks.  A day or so after I posted I found a good trivial list at http://eq.castersrealm.com/tradeskills/smithing/trivials.asp Now I know why those mantles
ygData.messageBody:
Thanks. A day or so after I posted I found a good trivial list at
http://eq.castersrealm.com/tradeskills/smithing/trivials.asp
Now I know why those mantles and cloaks have been such bears!

It looks like it's time for Shaepley Armor to start holding periodic
sales on mantles, gauntlets, and leggings, to keep the inventory
moving. My skill is now up to 136, and I must be one of the wealthier
level 9 players on Tholuxe Paells. ;) I was visiting Freeport for a
bit yesterday and saw someone selling Fine Steel armor already. Ack!
the competition! <Grin>




--- In EQ_SMITHS@egroups.com, "EQgamer" <eqgamenut@t...> wrote:
> Hello Shaepe
>
> You should keep doing banded untill 175 then start on plate.
Plan to
> spend about 1500pp or so unless your selling it all to players. I
did
> Mantle till 135 then gauntlets till 168 last of all cloak to 175.
You still
> fail quite a bit at plate but not as much as you would if you
started lower.
>
>
>

> > My question to you all is, now what? I thought about making
forged
> > weapons (already trivial), but was disappointed to find the cost
of
> > making the weapons (without failure) was more than what I could
sell
> > them for. I want to be able to make the new fine plate armor, but
> > don't know what I should do to prepare for that. What skill level
> > should I achieve before then? How do I get that level? (more
banded?)
> > Are there items I should be collecting now that I will need later?
> >
